values.alignmentText: Paris hosts strong .NET demand across finance/tech; bilingual developers are valued, with remote/hybrid roles and visa options.

values.key: Product Marketing Manager (Games): Continuing Education Availability
values.alignmentText: Paris, France offers occasional game-marketing trainings and short courses. Many options are remote or from visiting experts.

values.key: Spacious Housing Benchmark (2k sq ft Rent)
values.alignmentText: 2k sq ft rentals in Paris are scarce and move fast; expect premium rents and broker help to secure a family-sized apartment.

values.key: View of Them by Neighboring Countries
values.alignmentText: 8 - France enjoys solid EU ties; neighbors view it positively. Paris is seen as cosmopolitan, safe, and travel-friendly for families.
France/Paris offers several visa routes for a US founder and a tech dev: Talent Passport, Startup/Tech Visa, EU Blue Card; processes are clear but documentation-heavy.

Paris pairs historic charm with modern innovation, feeding family curiosity. English-friendly services and universal healthcare ease settling in.
Paris, France winters are mild. Sub-freezing nights occur but daytime temps hover around 5-10 C.
In Paris, France, the norm is a 35-hour workweek with strict overtime caps. This supports family‑friendly work–life balance.
In Paris, France, 35-hour weeks and strong parental leave support work–life; most firms value downtime and allow remote/hybrid options with clear boundaries.
